Award.AwardTitle: Geometric Flows and Almost Complex Geometry
Award.AbstractNarration:
The so-called almost complex structure is a fundamental notion in the study of even dimensional spaces in mathematics. The understanding of almost complex structure in dimension four is of major importance in the mathematical branch of Differential Geometry. This has also great impact on other subjects including Physics. The projects designed aim to use powerful tools from geometric analysis to study almost complex structure, which will lead to applications in string theory, algebraic geometry and complex geometry. The proposed research will have immediate beneficial effects to students in the principal investigator's home university.

The geometry of 4-dimensional smooth and symplectic manifolds has witnessed very exciting achievements in the last several decades. Despite the great success, the full understanding of smooth topology of four manifolds and symplectic manifolds remains largely open. In the last several decades, profound progress has also been made in the Ricci flow, for example, the solution of Poincare conjecture and geometrization conjecture in three manifolds. In this project, the PI will focus on compact almost complex manifolds by using a new kind of geometric flows, which evolve an almost complex structure to a symplectic structure. One motivation is to understand precisely when a compact four manifold with an almost complex structure supports a symplectic structure. Inspired by the Hamilton-Perelman's theory in the Ricci flow, the PI intends to study these new geometric flows in a systematical way, such as the longtime behavior and formation of singularities.

POR.DRECONTENT:
In the project entitled "Geometric flows and almost complex geometry", we propse to study various geometric paritial differenital equations, and their applications, in particular to almost complex geometry. The PI also studies various geometric partial differential equations from Kahler geometry, Sasaki geometry and conformal geometry. During the support of NSF for this project, the PI has written 15 papers, with 8 papers being published in distinguished math journals. 

Geometric analysis has made tremedeous applications in modern theory of geometry and has witnessed great progress in the last five decades also. The study of geometric partial differential equations and their applications on geometry and topology is the main theme in geometric analysis. 

Almost complex geometry contains the central topics such as complex geometry, symplectic geometry and Kahler geometry in modern theory of geometry. But as an independet subject, almost complex geometry does not have a well-developed theory using the technique in geometric analysis.

Our proposal tried to use the geometric analysis as a tool to study the almost complex manifolds as a general subject. The PI has made considerate progress in this direction. In short, the PI use the classical tools as in the theory of harmonic map to study harmonic almost complex structures and biharmonic almost complex structures. The PI proved the existence and regularity of biharmonic almost complex structures on a compact almost complex four-manifold. There are some new substantial technical inputs and the PI believes these objects would be very useful to study the general almost complex four-manifolds. The efforts in this direction have attract considerate interest from many experts and the PI has presented his findings in many workshop and seminars. 

The PI has  organized two conferences, including one international conference which brought most yound reaserchers in the field together to discuss the upfront progress.

The PI has also got involved with K12 eduation during the support of this project, including coorganizing a math club in a local school. In this hard year for almost everyone during the Covid-19 pandemic, the PI, together with a hogh school student Arnold Yang,  has coorganized a weekly Zoom meeting for local middle school students (with more than 50 regular participants).The primary topics are probmes for MEOMS (Math Olympiads for Elmentary and Middle Schools). The PI also introduces interest math concepts such as the concept of number system and general problem solving skills.The attahced picture was one session of the Zoom meeting.
